formatDescription: ELAN is a professional software tool to manually and semi-automatically annotate and transcribe audio or video recordings. It was developed by the Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics in Nijmegen.  The .eaf file contains the annotations.
formatProvenance: 09/2023 (v.115)- MIME Type added 'application/eaf+xml' and modified file type to 'Text (Structured) submitted by the Max Plank Insitute of Phsycholinguisitcs and Monash University. 04/2024 (v.118)- Signature updated to allow flexibility for byte length between tags. Submitted by Preservica based on samples provided by The Endanagered Languages Archive.

internalSignatures.name: ELAN Annotation File
internalSignatures.note: Magic bytes, BOF; Offset: 27-56; Magic Bytes: 'ANNOTATION_DOCUMENT' {0-256} 'AUTHOR='; EOF; Offset: 0; Magic Bytes: '</ANNOTATION_DOCUMENT>' followed by either 0x0A, 0x0D, 0x0D0A
